I can already tell from this job posting, and it’s lack of upfront transparency or care for the future employee, that the work environment would likely be toxic. I had to go through it a few times to get that intuition though.

Saw this on data-vis-jobs. Here is some free advice: there are way more viz jobs than viz people. Also I cant tell if the mobile web experience is bad because they are attempting to funnel me to their ios app or because nobody there ever uses it

Wish we lived in the alternate universe where the Twitter product team was as good as the gmail product team, introducing news tools like 10 years later that make a robust enjoyable experience in ways I did not even know I wanted (we still cannot save tweet drafts on web)
Make The Internet 90s Again

commits.message: fix: replace client-side process.env with runtimeConfig
fix: restore critical runtimeConfig to prevent client bundle corruption
refactor(error): clean up error page a little
refactor(purge): clean up unused node_modules files
feat(gitignore): add node_modules to gitignore file
docs(README): add game rules and features for CLI-DELTA-DOJO
feat: add hello world with title
feat: scaffold a page that shows off our prior work
delete old scripts, make better baseline class
